meanings.definition: To drink (a liquid) a little at a time
meanings.sent1: She likes to sip her tea slowly.
meanings.sent2: I sip my water throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: He sips his juice like it's the finest wine.
meanings.sent4: The hummingbird sips nectar from the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The cat sips milk from a tiny bowl.

meanings.sent1: She took a sip of the refreshing lemonade.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy a sip of coffee in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bird took a sip from the puddle.
meanings.sent4: The sip of soup warmed her up instantly.
meanings.sent5: He offered her a sip of his soda.
